Description.value: OS Timer
Increments once for every core clock
Increments once for every 64 core clock
The register is incremented only on writes to the R9-Software Increment (cp15.0.R9.c12.4)

Name.value: Instruction fetch that causes a refill at the lowest level of instruction or unified cache

Description.value: Each instruction fetch from normal cacheable memory that causes a refill from outside of the cache is counted. Accesses that do not cause a new cache refill but are satisfied from refilling data of a previous miss are not counted. Where instruction fetches consist of multiple instructions, these accesses count as single events. CP15 cache maintenance operations do not count as events. This counter increments for speculative instruction fetches and for fetches of instructions that reach execution

Name.value: Instruction fetch that causes a TLB refill at the lowest level of TLB

Description.value: Each instruction fetch that causes a translation table walk or an access to another level of TLB caching is counted. CP15 TLB maintenance operations do not count as events. This counter increments for speculative instruction fetches and for fetches of instructions that reach execution.

Name.value: Data read or write operation that causes a refill at the lowest level of data or unified cache

Description.value: Each data read from or write to normal cacheable memory that causes a refill from outside of the cache is counted. Accesses that do not cause a new cache refill, but are satisfied from refilling data of a previous miss are not counted. Each access to a cache line to normal cacheable memory that causes a new linefill is counted, including the multiple transaction of instructions such as LDM or STM, PUSH and POP. Write-through writes that hit in the cache do not cause a linefill and so are not counted. CP15 cache maintenance operations do not count as events. This counter increments for speculative data accesses and for data accesses that are explicitly made by instructions.

Name.value: Data read or write operation that causes a cache access at the lowest level of data or unified cache

Description.value: Each access to a cache line to normal cacheable memory is counted including the multiple transaction of instructions such as LDM or STM. CP15 cache maintenance operations do not count as events. This counter increments for speculative data accesses and for data accesses that are explicitly made by instructions

Name.value: Data read or write operation that causes a TLB refill at the lowest level of TLB

Description.value: Each data read or write operation that causes a translation table walk or an access to another level of TLB caching is counted. CP15 TLB maintenance operations do not count as events. This counter increments for speculative data accesses and for data accesses that are explicitly made by instructions.
This counter increments for every instruction that explicitly read data, including SWP. This counter only increments for instructions that are unconditional or that pass their condition codes.
The counter increments for every instruction that explicitly wrote data, including SWP. This counter only increments for instructions that are unconditional or that pass their condition codes.
This counter counts for all instructions, including conditional instructions that fail their condition codes.
This counts for each exception taken

This includes:
RFE <addressing_mode> <Rn>{!}
MOVS PC (and other similar data processing instructions)
LDM <addressing_mode> Rn{!}, <registers_and_pc>
This counter only increments for instructions that are unconditional or that pass their condition codes.

Name.value: Instruction that writes to the Context ID Register architecturally executed

Description.value: This counter only increments for instructions that are unconditional or that pass their condition codes.

Name.value: Software change of PC, except by an exception, architecturally executed

Description.value: This counter only increments for instructions that are unconditional or that pass their condition codes.

Name.value: Immediate branch architecturally executed, taken or not taken

Description.value: This includes B{L}, BLX, CB{N}Z, HB{L}, and HBLP. This counter counts for all immediate branch instructions that are architecturally executed, including conditional instructions that fail their condition codes.

Name.value: Procedure return, other than exception returns, architecturally executed

Description.value:
This includes:
BX R14
MOV PC, LR
POP {..., PC}
LDR PC, [R13], #offset
LDMIA R9!, {...,PC}LDR PC, [R9], #offset
This counter only increments for instructions that are unconditional or that pass their condition codes.
This counts each instruction that is an access to an unaligned address. This counter only increments for instructions that are unconditional or that pass their condition codes
This counts for every pipeline flush because of a misprediction from the program flow prediction resources.
Counts for every clock cycle

Name.value: Branches or other change in the program flow that could have been predicted by the branch prediction resources of the processor

Description.value: Branches or other change in the program flow that could have been predicted by the branch prediction resources of the processor
Counts the number of Data Cache read hits. Counts events.
Counts the number of Data Cache read misses. This includes data cache accesses that are non-cacheable. Counts events.
Counts the number of Data Cache write hits. Counts events
Counts the number Data Cache write misses. This includes data cache accesses that are non-cacheable and/or non-bufferable. Counts events
Counts the number of cycles of requests to the MMU bus. This request can come from multiple masters. Counts cycles
Counts the number of cycles the Instruction Cache requests the bus until the data returns. Counts cycles
Counts the number of cycles the Write Buffer requests the bus. Counts cycles
Counts the number of cycles the pipeline is held because of a load/store multiple instruction. Counts cycles
Counts the number of cycles the processor cannot dual issue because of a Carry flag dependency. Counts cycles
Counts the number of cycles the processor cannot dual issue because the register file does not have enough read ports and at least one other reason. Counts cycles
Counts the number of cycles a load or store instruction waits to retire from ROB0. Counts cycles
Counts the number of cycles a load or store instruction waits to retire from ROB0=1. Counts cycles
Counts the number of any Data write access. Counts events
Counts the number of any Data read access. Counts events
Counts the number of cycles ALU A2 is stalled. Counts cycles
Counts the number of write accesses to addresses already in the L2C. Counts events
Counts the number of write accesses to addresses not in the L2 Cache. Counts events
Counts the number of 64-bit read transactions (read ready) sent from the bus. Counts events
Counts the number of Instruction Cache read misses. Counts events
Counts the number of instruction TLB misses. Counts events
Counts the number of cycles the processor single issues. Counts cycles
Counts the number of times one branch retires. Counts events.
Counts the number of cycles the Re-order Buffer (ROB) is full. Counts cycle.

Counts the number of times the bus returns RDY to the MMU. This is a useful when determining bus efficiency. A user can use the signal that the MMU is requesting the bus and how long it takes on average for the data to return. (mmu_bus_req / mmu_read_count) Counts events
Counts the number times the bus returns ready to the Write Buffer. Counts events. This is useful to determine the average write latency of the write buffer (WB write latency/WB write count).
Counts the number of cycles the processor dual issues. Counts cycles
Counts the number of cycles the processor cannot dual issue because of a Read after Write hazard. Counts cycles.
Counts the number of cycles the issue is held. Counts cycles
Counts the total number of cycles that L2C line fill requests to the bus. Counts cycles.
Counts the number of times the Data cache is accessed. Counts events
Counts the number of data TLB misses. Counts events
Counts the number of mispredicted branches. Counts events
Counts the number of cycles ALU A1 is stalled. Counts cycles
Counts the number of cycles the Data cache requests the bus for a read. Counts cycles
Counts the number of cycles the Data cache requests the bus for a write. Counts cycles
Counts the number of cycles the processor cannot dual issue because the register file doesn't have enough read ports. Counts cycles
BIU Simultaneous Access
Counts the number of L2 Cache cache-to-bus external read requests. Counts events
Counts the number of L2 Cache read accesses that resulted in an external read request. Counts events.
Counts the number of evictions (Castouts) of a line from the L2 cache. Counts events.
Counts the number of instruction and data TLB misses. Counts events
Counts the number of taken branches. Counts events.
Counts the number of cycles WB is full. Counts cycles
Counts the number of times the bus returns Data to the Data cache during read requests. Counts events
Counts the number of times the bus returns ready to the Data cache during write requests. Counts events
Counts the number of cycles the processor cannot dual issue because of hardware conflict. Counts cycles
Counts the number of cycles the processor cannot dual issue because of multiple reasons. Counts cycles
Counts the number of cycles the BIU is accessed by any unit

Name.value: Main TLB refill caused by I-Cache

Description.value: Counts the number of Instruction fetch operations that causes a Main TLB walk

Name.value: Main TLB refill caused by D-Cache

Description.value: Counts the number of Data read or write operations that causes a Main TLB walk
Counts the number of times the bus returns RDY to the instruction cache, useful to determine the cache' average read latency (also known as "read miss" or "read count".

Name.value: Counts any event from external input source PMUEXTIN[0]

Description.value: Counts any event from external input source PMUEXTIN[0]

Name.value: Counts any event from external input source PMUEXTIN[1]

Description.value: Counts any event from external input source PMUEXTIN[1]

Name.value: Counts any event from both external input sources PMUEXTIN[0] and PMUEXTIN[1]

Description.value: Counts any event from both external input sources PMUEXTIN[0] and PMUEXTIN[1]
Counts the number of cycles when the WMMX2 store FIFO is full.
Counts the number of cycles when the WMMX2 finish FIFO is full.
Counts the number of cycles when the WMMX2 instruction FIFO is full
Counts the number of retired WMMX2 instructions
Counts the number of cycles when the WMMX2 is busy
Counts the number of cycles when WMMX2 holds the issue stage
Counts the number cycles when WMMX2 holds the writeback stage
L0IC line fill
L0IC hit prefetch buffer

Name.value: Non-idle cycles with no data bus utilization
Non-idle cycles when waiting for tRFC
